docs.snippet: President Donald Trump declared as "dead" on Monday a program that protects immigrants brought to the United States illegally as children and pressed Congress to pass legislation to secure the U.S. border with Mexico.

headline.print_headline: Trump Declares DACA 'Dead,' Urges Congress to Act on Border
headline.main: Trump Declares DACA 'Dead,' Urges Congress to Act on Border

docs.snippet: Some voters in a special House race supported Conor Lamb to express their dislike of the president. Others just liked Mr. Lamb better than his Republican opponent.

headline.print_headline: Lost in Glare of Trump, Candidates Themselves
headline.main: In Pennsylvania Election Shaped by Trump, Candidates Still Mattered

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday his infrastructure plan will likely have to wait until after the November congressional elections.

headline.print_headline: Trump Says Infrastructure Plan Will Likely Have to Wait Until 2018 Elections
headline.main: Trump Says Infrastructure Plan Will Likely Have to Wait Until 2018 Elections

docs.snippet: China briefed President Donald Trump on Tuesday on the visit by North Korean leader Kim Jong Un to Beijing, and the communication included a personal message from Chinese President Xi Jinping to Trump, the White House said in a statement.

headline.print_headline: China Briefs Trump on Kim Jong Un's Visit: White House
headline.main: China Briefs Trump on Kim Jong Un's Visit: White House

docs.snippet: An American academic who supports U.S. President Donald Trump and is a strong advocate of Britain's exit from the European Union will testify next month before the federal grand jury considering evidence in the investigation into possible collusio...

headline.print_headline: Trump Supporter Malloch Says He Will Testify to Mueller Grand Jury
headline.main: Trump Supporter Malloch Says He Will Testify to Mueller Grand Jury

docs.snippet: Two top Democrats on a House committee are demanding public hearings to force top Trump administration officials to explain their costly plane travel.

headline.print_headline: 2 Top Dems Demand Public Hearings on Trump Cabinet Travel
headline.main: 2 Top Dems Demand Public Hearings on Trump Cabinet Travel

docs.snippet: Adult film star Stormy Daniels is suing President Donald Trump's lawyer Michael Cohen for defamation after he called into question her claim that she had a sexual encounter with Trump, according to court documents filed on Monday.

headline.print_headline: Stormy Daniels Suing Trump Lawyer Michael Cohen for Defamation
headline.main: Stormy Daniels Suing Trump Lawyer Michael Cohen for Defamation

docs.snippet: Japanese government officials are bracing for Donald Trump to get tough in trade talks, and are particularly anxious that the U.S. president could target Prime Minister Shinzo Abe's weak-yen policies.

headline.print_headline: Japan Braces for Trump Assault on Trade, Yen Policy as Summit Looms
headline.main: Japan Braces for Trump Assault on Trade, Yen Policy as Summit Looms

docs.snippet: Defense Secretary Jim Mattis has spoken with U.S. President Donald Trump about the potential use of military funds for a border wall with Mexico, the Pentagon said on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: Trump Has Talked to Mattis About U.S.-Mexico Wall Funding: Pentagon
headline.main: Trump Has Talked to Mattis About U.S.-Mexico Wall Funding: Pentagon

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump on Thursday threatened to hold up the trade agreement his administration finalized this week with South Korea in an effort to gain more leverage in potential talks with North Korea.

headline.print_headline: Trump Warns He May Freeze SKorea Trade Deal for NKorea Talks
headline.main: Trump Warns He May Freeze SKorea Trade Deal for NKorea Talks
